stem: Applying anti‑брызг to jigs/fixtures can:

choices.text: Reduce брызг adhesion and cleanup time

rationales.CHOICE-2: Anti‑брызг on non‑weld surfaces reduces cleanup.

stem: Maintaining a short arc length generally:

rationales.CHOICE-1: Short arcs improve shielding effectiveness and bead control.

stem: Чтобы избежать наклёпа и трещин от случайных поджигов дуги, где следует выполнять поджиг?

choices.text: В любом месте на основном металле, затем зашлифовать
Только в зоне шва или на планках разгона
На обработанных поверхностях вдали от шва
На окрашенных участках для защиты стали

rationales.CHOICE-2: Случайные поджиги вызывают наклёп/трещины; поджиг выполнять в зоне шва или на планках разгона, а посторонние поджиги удалять по процедуре.

stem: If a temporary backing strip is used and drawings require removal, you should:

choices.text: Leave it in place to save time
Remove and grind smooth per drawing/WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса) after сварки

rationales.CHOICE-2: Follow drawings/WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса) for backing removal and finishing.

stem: Choosing an appropriate угол скоса кромок helps to:

choices.text: Allow электрода/torch access and proper penetration

rationales.CHOICE-2: Adequate groove angle is required for access and fusion.

stem: To remove slag without damaging the base metal, a chipping hammer should be used at:

choices.text: A shallow angle with controlled blows
A steep angle with heavy blows

rationales.CHOICE-1: Use a shallow angle and controlled blows to avoid base-metal damage.

stem: To maintain a consistent root gap during fit-up, you should use:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Use clamps and прокладки (шимы) to set and hold uniform gaps.

stem: Почему remove mill scale, paint, and oil before сварки?

choices.text: They can cause пористости and недостаточного сплавления

rationales.CHOICE-2: Contaminants produce gas and block fusion, causing defects.

stem: Maintaining consistent travel speed and arc length helps to:

choices.text: Produce uniform bead shape and fusion

rationales.CHOICE-2: Consistency supports uniform fusion and appearance.

stem: Что следует сделать at the end of a weld bead?

choices.text: Blend and fill the crater before stopping
Strike a new arc on the finished face

rationales.CHOICE-2: Filling craters снижает риск crater растрескивание.

stem: Что следует сделать at the end of a weld bead?

choices.text: Blend and fill the crater before stopping
Strike a new arc on the finished face

rationales.CHOICE-2: Filling craters снижает риск crater растрескивание.

stem: В конце a weld bead, a good practice is to:

choices.text: Fill and blend the crater before stopping
Strike off to the side and leave a crater

rationales.CHOICE-2: Filling the crater помогает avoid cracking and underfill.

stem: Selecting a larger керамической чашки/сопла/сопла in GTAW generally:

choices.text: Improves coverage for larger вылет проволоки if flow is adequate
Eliminates the need for a газовая линза

rationales.CHOICE-1: Bigger cups can cover more area with proper flow and often with a газовая линза.

stem: For out‑of‑position сварки, using a smaller электрода diameter often:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Smaller электродов help control the puddle overhead/vertical.

stem: Before сварки over tack welds, you should:

choices.text: Feather/clean them to avoid недостаточного сплавления

rationales.CHOICE-2: Feathered tacks blend smoothly into the weld.

stem: Чтобы избежать undercut on flat угловой шовs, a common practice is to hold:

choices.text: An excessive travel angle and long arc
A ~45° work angle with a slight travel angle and short arc
A 90° work angle with no travel angle
The torch perpendicular to both plates

rationales.CHOICE-2: Proper work/travel angles and short arc reduce undercut.

stem: Что a калибра для угловых швов measure?

choices.text: Fillet leg size or effective throat

rationales.CHOICE-2: Fillet gauges verify leg length and throat to drawing or code requirements.

stem: Что a калибра для угловых швов measure?

choices.text: Fillet leg size or effective throat

rationales.CHOICE-2: Fillet gauges verify leg length and throat to drawing or code requirements.

stem: A калибра для угловых швов is used to measure:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Gauges verify fillet size against requirements.

stem: Before сварки galvanized steel, you should:

choices.text: Удалить zinc coating locally and ensure ventilation

rationales.CHOICE-2: Removing zinc and ventilating уменьшает fume hazards and defects.

stem: Internal misalignment (hi-lo) can be checked with:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Use appropriate gauges to measure internal misalignment.

stem: Controlling межслойной температуры primarily helps to:

choices.text: Control metallurgical properties and reduce cracking risk

rationales.CHOICE-2: Interpass control manages microstructure and cracking susceptibility.

stem: Peening of weld metal should be used:

choices.text: Heavily on root and final passes
Lightly on intermediate passes only if permitted by code/WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса)
As a substitute for proper parameters

rationales.CHOICE-2: Peening can relieve stress but is restricted-avoid on root/final unless allowed.

stem: Changing сварки polarity from what the WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса) specifies may:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Incorrect polarity can reduce fusion and arc stability.

stem: Как следует power source полярность be chosen?

choices.text: Use the same полярность for all processes
Follow the WPS and consumable manufacturer requirements
Use DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность) for every job

rationales.CHOICE-2: Different processes and wires/rods require specific полярность for proper сплавление.

stem: Как следует power source полярность be chosen?

choices.text: Use the same полярность for all processes
Follow the WPS and consumable manufacturer requirements
Use DCEN (прямая полярность) (прямая полярность) for every job

rationales.CHOICE-2: Different processes and wires/rods require specific полярность for proper сплавление.

stem: If unexpected пористости appears, a first troubleshooting step is to:

choices.text: Check gas flow/coverage and surface cleanliness

rationales.CHOICE-2: Verify защитного газа and cleanliness before changing parameters.

stem: Почему rotate parts on a позиционера/turntable when possible?

choices.text: To weld in the flat position for better quality and deposition
To remove the need for fit-up

rationales.CHOICE-2: Flat‑position сварки improves control and productivity.

stem: Before production сварки on a new setup, a good approach is to:

choices.text: Run practice beads on scrap of similar material and thickness

rationales.CHOICE-2: Practice beads help dial in parameters and technique.

stem: Как следует предварительного подогрева be verified?

choices.text: With temperature-indicating crayons or a thermometer

rationales.CHOICE-2: Use objective temperature indicators to confirm required предварительного подогрева.

stem: Как следует предварительного подогрева be verified?

choices.text: With temperature-indicating crayons or a thermometer

rationales.CHOICE-2: Use objective temperature indicators to confirm required предварительного подогрева.

stem: Excessive предварительный подогрев beyond WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса) requirements may:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Too much предварительный подогрев can coarsen microstructure and increase distortion.

stem: Что такое a reliable way to verify предварительный подогрев temperature?

choices.text: Using temperature-indicating crayons or a thermometer

rationales.CHOICE-2: Use objective temperature indicators to confirm предварительный подогрев.

stem: Что такое the purpose of a root face (land) on a groove?

choices.text: To help control root penetration and support the root
To eliminate the need for backing

rationales.CHOICE-2: A small land помогает control root penetration and bead shape.

stem: Run-on/run-off tabs are installed to:

choices.text: Start/stop off the part and achieve full fusion at tie-ins

rationales.CHOICE-2: Tabs allow full penetration and clean tie-ins without damaging part edges.

stem: Shielding gas flow for GMAW (MIG/MAG)/GTAW (TIG) should be set to:

choices.text: The highest possible to be safe
Provide stable coverage without turbulence or aspiration
A fixed value for all соплаs

rationales.CHOICE-2: Set flow to protect the pool; too much flow causes turbulence and air entrainment.

stem: Skip or back‑step сварки sequences are used mainly to:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Heat distribution уменьшает distortion and residual stress.

stem: Что следует сделать between weld passes with флюс-shielded processes?

choices.text: Water-quench шлак to speed the job

rationales.CHOICE-2: Cleaning between passes предотвращает шлак inclusions and улучшает сплавление.

stem: Что следует сделать between weld passes with флюс-shielded processes?

choices.text: Water-quench шлак to speed the job

rationales.CHOICE-2: Cleaning between passes предотвращает шлак inclusions and улучшает сплавление.

stem: Между проходами with flux‑shielded processes you should:

choices.text: Leave slag; it will burn out

rationales.CHOICE-2: Cleaning предотвращает slag inclusions and promotes fusion.

stem: On stainless steel, use a wire brush that is:

rationales.CHOICE-2: Avoid cross-contamination; use stainless-only brushes on stainless.

stem: For low‑hydrogen электродов on many applications, it is preferable to use:

choices.text: Stringer beads or limited weave per WPS (спецификации сварочного процесса)

rationales.CHOICE-2: Stringers help control heat input and hydrogen cracking risk.

stem: Зачем удалять oil, rust, paint, and mill scale before welding?

choices.text: To уменьшить пористости and lack of сплавление

rationales.CHOICE-2: Contaminants cause gas generation and предотвращает сплавление at the interface.

stem: Зачем удалять oil, rust, paint, and mill scale before welding?

choices.text: To уменьшить пористости and lack of сплавление

rationales.CHOICE-2: Contaminants cause gas generation and предотвращает сплавление at the interface.

stem: Как следует tack welds be placed to control деформации?

choices.text: All tacks on one side of the joint
Balanced around the joint to hold alignment

rationales.CHOICE-2: Balanced, adequate tacks hold fit-up and уменьшить деформации during welding.

stem: Как следует tack welds be placed to control деформации?

choices.text: All tacks on one side of the joint
Balanced around the joint to hold alignment

rationales.CHOICE-2: Balanced, adequate tacks hold fit-up and уменьшить деформации during welding.

stem: Как следует tack welds be prepared for incorporation into the final weld?

choices.text: Feather/clean tacks so they fuse smoothly into the weld

rationales.CHOICE-2: Feathered, clean tacks reduce lack-of-fusion at tie-ins.

stem: Increasing travel speed (all else equal) generally:

choices.text: Lowers heat input and narrows the bead

rationales.CHOICE-2: Higher travel speed уменьшает heat input and penetration.

stem: При использовании powered wire brushes, wear:

choices.text: No eye protection; bristles are soft
Safety glasses and a face shield

rationales.CHOICE-2: Wire bristles can eject; use both glasses and a face shield.
